Reviews.Title: “Snow in Rome :)”
Reviews.Author: glogloman
Reviews.Content: We (me and my girfriend) stayed there for wonderful 4 nights. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was so nice and cleaned every day. The price was same like in the cheapest hostels (own double-bed room), but the service was on higher level! The breakfasts were absolutely great - original italiano espresso or cappuccino (or tea), delicious fresh croissants and other Italian sweets as many you can eat, butter, jam, orange juice and also packed hotel crispy toasts. Location is also good - not noisy, very close to Termini station - c. 300 meters to underground and also close to Colosseum (c. 15 minutes of walking). In spite of that in Rome was only about 4°C and our last day of stay was snowing (second time per last 26 years!) in the room was warm temperature enought - there is heating (what is not so usual in the Rome) and also air condition which can heat until 30°C. Overall we want to suggest to everyone! We enjoyed it there so much! :) Grazie, arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Quality place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Em G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aquarium was a great hotel experience for my friend and I. It was extremely close to the Roma Termini (5 minute walk). The bathroom was clean and the sheets looked sanitary as well. The front desk was helpful, they gave us a map, restaurant advice, and free luggage storage after we had checked out. Breakfast was a nice thing to have as well, typical European breakfast consisting of croissants, rolls, jams, butter, and coffee to order. Nothing special, but a time saver in the morning. They also had wifi, but only in the lobby. The only thing i would warn people about is the fact that the hotel lobby is on one floor above the ground floor, so you have to ring the buzzer to be let in. My friend and I (two girls) never felt unsafe, but we also did not stay out past 12 each night.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren B
Reviews.Content: As me and my other half were travelling around Europe for a month last summer, Rome was our final resting place. The Hotel itself was very handy for us, being only a two minute walk away from the train station. We were warmly welcolmed and showed where our room was. The room we had was very dated and dingy. Dark green, and only one tiny window that was in the side of the wall so hardly any light came in at all. In the early morning you could hear the bins being collected, but this wasn't a big negative for us, just one of those things. Overall, the room suited what we needed...a place to sleep at night! We really weren't using it for much more than that, and from the hotel we walked to every place we wanted to see, except the Vatican city were we got the train too. Breakfast is included in the price which is good, but when we were there it looked like either a large family group, or a small school group, were staying at the same time, and really the breakfast area was not big enough to accomodate everyone, so we only ate in the area once during our stay. Was alright, bread, pastries, tea coffee etc. However, out of everything, the service was great, with the owners doing all they can to accomodate you, even phoning us a taxi to take us to the airport. Don't expect a fancy hotel, but great for people on a budget wanting to explore!

Reviews.Title: “Like Family. Best Location. Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jiany36
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is amazing. Talk with Tony at the front desk who is there the major portion of the day. He'll treat you like family. Need a question answered, ask Tony. The hotel is very cozy and very close to the Bus Terminus. It includes a morning breakfast and great service. Book now and enjoy a super exciting trip in Rome. At least I did : ) OH tips in ROME: If you like walking and you'll be there at least 3 days, then don't buy the bus tour, just walk. Get the map from Tony and literally walk from the hotel to close to the Vatican in 30 min. We bought the bus tour then the next day we gave it up and walked. If you get tired just catch the city bus for 1e. Just see a popular site you want to go to and ask at the bus termini for the # bus that goes there. To get back to the hotel just ask what bus goes to the termini, then walk from the termini to the hotel (2min) OH, as for resto's ck trip advisor. Your'll see great recommendation, just choose Italian food, Dinning, $70 and under and you'll have excellent resto's at 14e a person. OH. To and from the hotel from airport is 4 euros each way eachperson. Take bus company called .... hmm i don't have the name with me, but the bus stops on the opposite side of the termini from Aquarium's side's hotel. I told Tony about it, just ask him. The info inside the termini don't even know about it or won't tell you cause they want you to use their train at 15 e each. Enjoy and have a blast : )

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Tallmrpaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in July and loved it! Let's be honest, in a place like Rome, your not going to be in your hotel for long periods, and as such, it did everything we needed it too, location is perfect, minimum travel to any attraction, service was very good, a very homely kind of feel I thought, the staff were great, helped us a few times with buses etc, always joking and making conversation as well, which isnt something I've experienced in a hotel before. Even let us hang around in the lobby for 2 hours after we checked out whilst we waited for our transfer to the airport,mand considering the lobby is quite small, that really impressed me! Would urge everyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Value”
Reviews.Author: JorgenH
Reviews.Content: A Great value Hotel, large rooms with balconies and views of the Roma aquarium. Personal service for breakfast. Short distance to Termini and walking distance to Colloseum. Short distance to two of the stops for sightseeing buses. In short, a good hotel in terms of price. Beware of the old mother who is night watchman she is a bit grumpi if you wake her.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful of your BELONGINGS ...................................”
Reviews.Author: bozybozy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aquarium for 3 days, honestly we cant find the address easily as the hotel is in 2nd floor, but the WORST case is BE CAREFUL with your belongings when you leave the rooms for day trip. Our luggage was broken into and we lost our new purchased LV bag and wallets which we hide inside our own luggage and clearly to my remembrance the nite before was in my luggage ..... So its true the saying goes ... Be careful in ITALY too many thieves but we never think this happened in AQUARIUM hotel, in my own room 523, our prediction is the HOUSEKEEPER ..

Reviews.Title: “Very very average - you could do much better”
Reviews.Author: BillyandNic
Reviews.Content: The one good thing about this hotel is the location, but only if you are wanting something close to the main railway/metro station. Otherwise there is very little to recommend it, and there are loads of other hotels in the area which looked nicer (from the outside at least). We knew it was a basic hotel but were still disappointed. There are a few things that made our stay unpleasant: the neighbourhood feels a little dodgy, there is no soundproofing so expect to be awake at least half the night, the bathroom was tiny and not that clean (bins not emptied for 3 days) despite the very strong chemical smell, the shower was so small you can hardly move and it did not drain properly, so you end up standing in a few inches of water and after maybe about 2 minutes you actually have to turn the shower off to let it drain otherwise it would flood, then you can resume your shower for another few minutes....and repeat the process.... Also very expensive for what we got. Rome is not that big, so you don't really need to stay near the station anyway....

Reviews.Title: “Great prices, convenient to Metro and Train”
Reviews.Author: kiwigal999
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in this hotel, both were good, one much larger than the other. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and they made us feel very welcome. It is very handy to the Metro and the train station. There is wifi in the lobby and an ok breakfast. There is limited luggage space so we ended up taking our bags to the train station left luggage. overall clean and quiet. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Jilene
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant little place. Proximity to Termini is great. Situated on a quiet street, we had a lovely little room with a delightful balcony. Air conditioning was great, room clean and bathroom adequate for our needs. Hair dryer was supplied when requested. Staff were only too pleased to help; concierge gave great advice for tours and when we checked out mega early we were given coffee and pastries before we left. You get what you pay for in terms of luxury, but the helpulness and friendliness of the staff is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ieiita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aquarium with my family last month for 5 nights. The rooms were really big for a 2-star hotel, they cleaned and changed towels every day. Breakfast was pretty good and the staff very nice! Location is great, it´s 1 block away from the Termini train station (there are non-stop trains to Fiumicino every hour)... Subways and buses stop are there too, even though you are just a few minutes walk to many attactions...

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy, refused to honour booking price.”
Reviews.Author: sunnysai
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through Laterooms in early January 2010 for stay in May 2010 because of its location close to central station. However, not long after I had booked the room for 59 Euros a night, the hotel emailed me to say they will NOT honour the original booking price. Instead, they want 75 Euros a night. I had made a complaint through Laterooms and Laterooms did follow it up on my behalf. The resolution they offered to Laterooms was that they will honour the original booking price. When I email the hotel directly to seek their confirmation however, they say they will not honour it. They only offer 70 Euros a night or cancel the booking. So I suspect they will say anything to please Laterooms with no intention to honour the resolution. Base on the negative booking experience, I have lost faith staying with this hotel and had canceled my booking with them.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Swazzy
Reviews.Content: We got a friendly welcome upon arrival and the room was clean. The breakfast is okay if you have a sweet tooth. The neighbourhood isn't really interesting, but the proximity to Termini Station is great. For high season this room was not very expensive and you definitely get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody awful”
Reviews.Author: emmanuelle29
Reviews.Content: Calling this place horrible is an understatement. The decor of the room was nasty and migraine inducing (clearly not been re-decorated since the 1970s), the fabric wallcovering was filthy and smelt. The room only had a small window and was so dark it resembled a prison cell. The aircon did not cool the room, however made enough noise to rival a jumbo jet - if that's what you're after than great if you wish to sleep not so great. The bathroom was tiny and looked like it could fall apart any second, and hot water elusive. (when I told the oger at reception about this, I was barked at and told to go back to my room and wait- naturally as a guest I shouldn't expect hot water- I'm clearly far too demanding) The staff were unhelpful, did not attempt to communicate with the guests, they just grunted or alternatively barked. The towels and sheets looked like they had been through the war, actually the towel was more fray than towel. The bed was like concrete and the pillows flat as pancakes, but i presume they are very concerned about their guests backs. To top off the wonderful night I spent there, the tv in the hotel lounge was on until 2am and the receptionist on night duty was clearly hard of hearing, sadly I'm not. Oh and then there were the bins outside our windows which stank (a pretty amazing achievement to smell bins 2 floors up) and were emptied by a big loud truck at 4am, really gets you into the local atmosphere. I didn't even stay for breakfast, I fled in hope of avoiding an imminent nervous breakdown. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel: Good value”
Reviews.Author: Pedersen_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Recommendable. Great hotel located close to the railway station Termini. Great if you after all are out the most of the day. PROS: - Location (close to Termini and some attractions: ex Forum Romanum etc.) - Cosy hotel - Okay clean rooms in quiet neighbourhood - Small cosy family-owned hotel CONS: - Breakfast (not very inspireing)

Reviews.Title: “honest opinion”
Reviews.Author: jlbrld
Reviews.Content: PROS: it is 2 block from the train/sub station lots of local resturants, that serve great food for 1/2 what you pay downtown breakfast is simple but good, coffee, juice, tea, breads and cereals king size bed....very unusual in europe individual ac unit nice staff, fresh towels every day CONS: it is an older building rooms are a little worn, bedspreads, curtains, wallpaper showers are small......2 ft X 2 ft, is an accurate estimate showering at non busy times for more pressure mold in ceiling in bathroom, just a few coin size spots depending where your room is located you can hear people in stariwell OVERALL: my hubby and I found this place to be a great value, nice staff and convient location to the subway. The neighborhood is a little dark at night and the trash dumpsters are full but, we never had any problems with beggars...I think because it is not in the "tourist" district. The resturants around the hotel are GREAT, they have friendly service, some offer english menus, and the prices are 1/2 of what you pay downtown. approx 5 euros fro a plain pizza, 3 euros for a cappachino, 8 euros for pasta and 6 euros for desserts. Downtown by the Piazza Spagna we paid 15 euros for a pizza!!! I found the breakfast each morning to be sufficent. It is a continental breakfast with breads, cereal, and fruits. We would stay here again. It was perfect for our budget...we wanted to spend more on experiences than our room, where we were for just hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hersheyabb
Reviews.Content: The Aquarium was a nice stay in a convenient location if you are traveling by train. The subway and the tour buses also are at the train station as well as the city buses so it is easy to get around from there. The neighborhood itself may not be the best, but we had no problems. Just a block down the street are three restaurants. The two we ate at, Giuseppei's and Mario's (that may have been the name of the waiter, not the restaurant) were nice as well. While it would be a long walk to the Vatican, the subway will get you to within three blocks of the entrance to the Sistine chapel and museum in about 15 minutes. The staff was good and the breakfast was typical but satisfying. The room was large and well appointed. The shower was a little small, but not a problem and had plenty of hot water as there is a water heater in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on this hotel we honestly can say what exactly did these people expect for 50 EUROS a night for a twin room with breakfast included?! Obviously it is not going to be the Ritz but if you want to go to a hotel that is in the centre of Rome within walking distance of ALL historic sights or 2 minutes from the main train station then this is the perfect hotel. The hotel itself was secure with you having to identify yourself before entering and the street on which it is on was safe at all times of the day or night. The rooms were a decent size, cleaned everyday with fresh towels, comfortable beds and hot runnning water at all times. The staff were very friendly and helpful quite happy to give directions, advice and recommmendations for local restaurants etc. While on the subject of local restaurants turn right out of the hotel, proceed down the street a few hundred metres and on the opposite side is a restaurant (trattatoria Giovanni's) that serves the best homemade Italian food in the area at a excellent price that must be tried on your holiday in Rome!!! Tip: Save your money for the food dont feel obliged to buy roses or give money to every street musician that comes along during your meal, pay them once per group per meal and only buy a rose if you want to. As for the breakfast, it comprises of cornflakes, croissants and italian bread, condiments, fresh orange, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, cappuccino alll of which you can have as much as you want. Besides with so much such good value, filling italian food available locally who cares if you have a basic breakfast you are saving yourself for your main meals! As you can tell we could talk all day about what a great holiday we have had and of how pleased we were with our choice of hotel. Clare and Chris xx

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying here, it is soooo close to the train station, therefore-- no taxi costs and it's very close to the Colosseum and other sights. The room was very spacious and the windows opened directly into a little courtyard w/ authentic Italian apartments outside of it. We had hot water, but the showers were extremely small, but it wasn't a big deal. Breakfast wasn't the best, but any hotel like that, it's kinda what you expect. The lobby was really nice and we only had 4 rooms on our floor. We liked that you had to be buzzed in for security- the staff was very friendly and nice and will negotiate a discount if you pay in cash -- if they won't, just put it on a credit card. We had room service everyday and enjoyed the open aired spaciousness of the room. We would stay here again for the location, the prices were a bit high for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: girl_77
Reviews.Content: Honestly didn't expect much after reading the most recent review. So when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised when the hotel staff spoke excellent english and was very friendly. We had a small but clean room. The beds were very firm but comfortable enough and clean. The bathroom was very basic but hot water was available and the towels were cleaned every day. The breakfast was very italian (since they tend to eat a sweet roll in combination with a cappuccino). But sweet rolls, rusk with cheese or jam were available unlimited. So were coffee, cappuccino and tea. So in all it wasn't that bad. It isn't a "contintental" buffet but you could eat what you wanted. Honestly the only truely bad thing is the fact that our room was in the hallway near the reception and the breakfast room, so noise could be heard regularly and that our room (like some others) was in a small street where the garbage was standing. In november perhaps not as much of a problem but in the summer I am certain that the smell will be quite unattractive. Oh... and i forget to say, the wallpaper...absolutely hidious! hahaha. In conclusion... I would stay here again NO problem. The location close to termini station (5 minutes walk with luggage) and to many of the tourist attractions was absolutely super.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again untill is renewed totally.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the Termini station, but to the back side, to the front side where all the buses get connected is more or less 15 minutes walking, the rooms are clean, but the entrance to the hotel as the elevator are chocking very bad. The breakfast very bad too, and in general is an extremely old building. But is clean, and if you want to save it is O.k., but I wouldn't stay there again, I prefer to pay 10 or 20 Euros more and to feel more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “when in rome...”
Reviews.Author: MyLSD
Reviews.Content: hotel aquarium was decent considering the expensive rates offered by other hotels in Rome for late May/Early June. I found it inconvenient to have to ring a bell to get through the door, which leads to a tiny lift, up to the second floor where the hotel starts. The room was on the smaller side, but was definitely clean and stayable. My room was supposed to have a/c but didn't so they ended up bringing us a fan and discounting the room rate. That was fine by us as we were fortunately in Rome when it was not too hot. The hotel is about two blocks away from the train station which was VERY convenient. It was also walking distance to get over to Nazionale street, which from there you could probably find a metro or bus anywhere. Rome is huge, so as long as we were close to a metro and the train station, it was good for us. p.s. if you are paying when you get there... they will try to ask you to pay in cash... if that is the case, and you have the funds... negotiate a discount!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located. Literally 1 minute walk from trains, metro and buses. Generally very friendly and helpful staff. Clean enough although shower not so good. Don't count on the breakfast though because it's hopeless. My partner and i both reckon it's very good value for a city centre location and having thrown our coins into the Trevi Fountain, will certainly stay there again when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Far from a pretty hotel but no big problems should be noted. If you just want to sleep and get a shower this can be the place. Expect no good decoration or charm. The hotel does not have a lobby at the floor level - it is a regular entrance of an habitation building. Breakfast? Only the cappucino saves it... plastic bag toasts and croissants. But the price is fair for good location with lots of transportation nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aquarium
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Manfredo Fanti, 10, 00185 Rome, Italy
